arts.sum: The visitors had a chance at the start of the second half as they worked the ball down the left and Hugo Bueno swung in a cross, Munetsi chested it down for Joao Gomes, but he lashed it wide inside the box. Wolves improved marginally as the half progressed and had some good set piece opportunities, while one dangerous Munetsi cross caught the eye, but they were still lacking the final ball.

arts.ttl: Nordi Mukiele on target as Sunderland sink Wolves to continue strong start
arts.athr: Louise Taylor at the Stadium of Light
arts.sum: Régis Le Bris looked concerned. “We can feel the danger,” said Sunderland’s manager last week as he suggested that a Wolves renaissance could be just round the corner. If so, that old gold revival suffered a damaging delay on an an afternoon when Le Bris’s fears proved groundless as Sunderland registered their fourth Premier League win in eight games since promotion. It leaves them with 14 points and surely set fair for survival. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: 'Magic' team goal helps superb Sunderland beat winless Wolves
arts.sum: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights from Sunderland’s win against Wolves in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Sunderland’s impressive home form continues with victory over lowly Wolves
arts.sum: The Black Cats profited from Nordi Mukiele’s first-half strike and a Ladislav Krejci own goal.

arts.ttl: Sunderland's impressive PL start continues as Wolves remain winless
arts.sum: Sunderland’s impressive start to life back in the Premier League continued as the Wearsiders beat winless Wolves 2-0 at the Stadium of Light.

arts.ttl: Andy’s Player Ratings: Sunderland 2-0 Wolves – Another 3 points at home!
arts.sum: Robin Roefs: 7/10 Didn’t have much to do and was well protected by his defence but made one really good save to his left, another with his feet in injury time and was reliable in the air and with the ball. Trai Hume: 8/10 Played on the left of the defence today and did a […]

arts.ttl: High-flying Sunderland too strong for basement side Wolves at Stadium of Light
arts.sum: Nordi Mukiele puts in a starring performance as Sunderland record a 2-0 victory over Wolverhampton Wanderers at the Stadium of Light.

arts.ttl: Sunderland vs Wolves – Match Preview and Team News
arts.sum: Sunderland will aim to continue their impressive home form on Saturday when they host a crisis-ridden Wolves side still searching for their first Premier League win. The newly-promoted Black Cats have made a superb start to the season. Wolves, in contrast, are rock bottom of the table.
